H0.text: A parasite is the type of organism that generally lives in or on its host.

H1.text: Predator is a type of organism that generally lives in or on its host.

H2.text: Bacteria are organisms that generally live in or on their host.

H3.text: Insects are a type of organism that generally live in or on their host.

A4.text: Parasites live (at least some of the time) on or inside another organism, the host

A5.text: Parasites include single-celled protozoans such as the agents of malaria, sleeping sickness, and amoebic dysentery; animals such as hookworms, lice, mosquitoes, and vampire bats; fungi such as honey fungus and the agents of ringworm; and plants such as mistletoe, dodder, and the broomrapes.

A6.text: Parasites reduce host fitness by general or specialised pathology, that ranges from parasitic castration to modification of host behaviour.

A7.text: Many bacteria are parasitic, though they are more generally thought of as pathogens causing disease.
